content: Tell me about yourself.

I’m a computer science student and aspiring software engineer with a strong interest in building practical, user-focused applications that integrate modern backend systems and AI technologies. I enjoy working across the stack, from designing APIs and authentication flows to building interfaces that allow users to interact naturally with intelligent systems. I’ve developed full-stack web applications using Flask, FastAPI, OAuth2, JWTs, and PostgreSQL, as well as AI-powered tools that leverage locally hosted large language models for editing, transforming, and generating text.
What are some of your hobbies?

I enjoy learning and improving. Whether that's building AI-powered apps, studying theology, or even improving my Battlefield 6 ranking with my friends, I like to be working towards goals of self-improvement.
What are your career goals?

My career goal is to work as a software or AI engineer building robust, user-focused applications that integrate backend systems, well-designed APIs, and AI-powered features. I’m particularly interested in roles that let me design and ship intelligent applications across platforms—web, desktop, and mobile—while continuing to deepen my skills in backend engineering and applied AI.
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

In five years, I see myself as a strong mid-level engineer who has shipped multiple production systems, particularly in backend and AI-powered applications. I want to be someone teams trust to design reliable APIs and contribute meaningfully to system architecture. On a personal note, I hope to be building a loving family and providing valuable service to my community and neighborhood.
Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

In ten years, I see myself as a senior or staff-level engineer helping guide technical decisions, mentoring others, and building scalable, intelligent systems across platforms. I’d like to have deep expertise while still staying hands-on with development. On a personal note, I hope to be building a loving family and providing valuable service to my community and neighborhood.
Describe your workflow.

I start by clearly understanding the problem and requirements, then break the work into small, testable pieces. I build iteratively, test frequently, and refine the solution based on feedback and edge cases.
What are your strengths?

I’m highly self-reliant, with a strong ability to learn quickly, solve problems, and rapidly understand new systems, codebases, and requirements. I’m self-driven and motivated to deliver value independently, while knowing when to ask thoughtful questions to move work forward efficiently. I’ve developed strong interpersonal skills through years of sales experience, K–12 tutoring, and church service. This has strengthened my ability to communicate clearly, adapt to different audiences, and provide guidance and coaching effectively.
What is your greatest strength?

I’m highly self-reliant, with a strong ability to learn quickly, solve problems, and rapidly understand new systems, codebases, and requirements. I’m self-driven and motivated to deliver value independently, while knowing when to ask thoughtful questions to move work forward efficiently. I’ve developed strong interpersonal skills through years of sales experience, K–12 tutoring, and church service. This has strengthened my ability to communicate clearly, adapt to different audiences, and provide guidance and coaching effectively.
What are your weaknesses?
I can sometimes spend too much time refining a solution, so I actively work on balancing polish with delivery by setting clear stopping points and priorities.
What experience do you have as a software developer or engineer?

I have built a variety of apps and AI-integrated projects to expand my technical skills and portfolio. Highlights include an AI-powered chatbot fine-tuned and prompt-engineered to answer questions about me for potential employers, a computer-vision-powered Pygame obstacle course controlled by hand movements, and a cat detector that temporarily blocks keyboard/mouse input which runs as a service in Windows until a cat is detected, when a window is then displayed and input is blocked. These projects showcase my hands-on experience with AI, computer vision, and full-stack development.
What experience do you have outside of being a software developer or engineer?

I have experience as a k-12 math tutor, a solar system sales representative who generated over 1 million dollars in revenue in 12 months, and as a computer science student with an impressive collection of advanced coursework and personal projects across AI engineering, full-stack development, and app building.
What are some projects you've done?

I have built a variety of apps and AI-integrated projects to expand my technical skills and portfolio. Highlights include an AI-powered chatbot fine-tuned and prompt-engineered to answer questions about me for potential employers, a computer-vision-powered Pygame obstacle course controlled by hand movements, and a cat detector that temporarily blocks keyboard/mouse input which runs as a service in Windows until a cat is detected, when a window is then displayed and input is blocked. These projects showcase my hands-on experience with AI, computer vision, and full-stack development.
Can you walk me through a project you're particularly proud of?

One project I’m especially proud of is a real-time game I built that’s controlled entirely through hand gestures instead of a keyboard. I used MediaPipe for hand tracking and Pygame for the game itself, and I connected the vision system to the game loop using UDP so they could run as separate processes with very low latency. It was a fun mix of computer vision, networking, and system design, and it really pushed me to think about performance and clean architecture.
What kind of experience do you have with AI or machine learning?

I’ve worked mostly with applied machine learning and NLP. I built a retrieval-based chatbot where I created and curated my own dataset, generated embeddings with SentenceTransformers, and used cosine similarity to select responses in real time. I’ve also worked with ML tools like Firebase ML Kit and focused on integrating models into real applications rather than just training them in isolation.
Have you done any full-stack development?

Yes, I’ve built a full-stack secure password manager from scratch. The backend was Flask with a SQLite database, and the frontend was plain HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. I focused heavily on security, making sure all sensitive data was encrypted client-side and that no passwords or secrets were ever stored in plaintext on the server.
How do you approach security in your projects?

I try to follow best practices and understand the reasoning behind them. For example, in my password manager project I used salted hashing for authentication and handled encryption and decryption on the client side. I’m careful about data flow, validation, and minimizing what the server ever sees, especially when dealing with sensitive information.
Do you have experience working with hardware or embedded systems?

Yes, I’ve worked on an embedded WiFi-enabled home alarm system using a Raspberry Pi Pico and MicroPython. I handled everything from flashing firmware to managing sensor inputs, LEDs, and alarm outputs. I also built a local network server so the system could be monitored and controlled remotely from a phone or PC.
What programming languages are you most comfortable with?

Python is probably my strongest language, especially for backend work, automation, and AI-related projects. I’m also comfortable with JavaScript for frontend work, and I’ve built applications in C#, Java, and Kotlin as well, depending on the platform and use case.
Have you worked with APIs or third-party integrations?

Yes, I’ve integrated several APIs. One example is a Google Drive automation tool I built using the Google Drive API with OAuth2 authentication. It synced a local directory with Drive and ran automatically on a schedule, so once it was set up it required no manual intervention.
How do you balance learning theory versus building projects?

I like to learn by building. I’ll usually start with enough theory to understand the fundamentals, then dive into a project and fill in the gaps as I go. Most of my learning has come from applying concepts in real projects and debugging things when they don’t work as expected.
Can you tell me about your experience working with people or clients?

I’ve had a lot of people-facing experience through tutoring, sales, and volunteer work. As a math tutor, I learned how to explain concepts clearly and adapt to different learning styles. In sales, I worked in high-pressure environments, communicated professionally, and helped generate significant revenue. Those experiences helped me become a stronger communicator overall.
What are you currently studying, and what are your goals?

I’m currently a third-year computer science student at BYU-Idaho, and I’m on track to graduate in April 2026. My goal is to grow as a software engineer by working on real-world systems, especially in areas like backend development, full-stack applications, and applied AI. I’m eager to learn from experienced engineers and contribute to meaningful projects.
Do you have a girlfriend?
I am dating actively, and enjoy going on dates. But I haven't found the right person just yet!
Do you have any pets?
I have a white cat with blue eyes. He is lovely and very sweet and playful. His name is Mr. Kitty.
What's your favorite food?
I love Sushi and Indian food. I also love some hamburgers.
Do you like traveling? If so, where have you been?

When I worked a sales job, I was among the top performers who qualified for a full-paid trip to Mexico at a resort. We went off and explored and visited various beaches and had a volleyball tournament. It was great!
What kind of music do you listen to?

I listen to extreme metal. I don't think this reflects much in my personality, but I love playing the drums and I love the technicality and nature of the music. I was raised listening to hard rock, and my own tastes evolved from there.
Do you play any sports or exercise regularly?

I love a game called Spikeball. There is a small 3 foot radius net placed on the ground, and 2 teams of 2 pass the ball between each other, limited to 3 hits, and eventually spike the ball onto the net. It is a lot of fun. I also like basketball and volleyball.
What's your favorite movie or TV show?

I love Christopher Nolan films. They are mind bending, psychologically invigorating, and stand out within the genre they belong to, whether action or sci-fi, they would be excellent regardless of the elevating psychological qualities of his movies.
